New Records: South Africa scored 399 runs for 7 wickets, their highest score in the World Cup 2023
Key Match Events: South Africa's Heinrich Klaasen scored 109 runs off 67 balls, forming a 151-run partnership with Marco Jansen (75 not out off 42 balls)
England were dismissed for 170 runs in 22 overs, their lowest score in the tournament
Pre-Game Insights: The match was England's most significant defeat in the World Cup 2023, with a margin of 229 runs
South Africa's victory consolidated their position as the third-ranked team with a net run rate of +2.21
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa captain Aiden Markram highlighted the team's comfort in batting first and effective pace bowling
England captain Jos Buttler expressed disappointment and mentioned the team's struggles due to injuries and poor performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the 14th largest margin of loss in ODI World Cup history
South Africa's win moved them to ninth in the points table, while England dropped to ninth with a net run rate of -1.25
